New Records: South Africa equalled the record for most centuries hit by a team in a single edition of the World Cup.
South Africa broke the record for most sixes hit in a single edition of the tournament.
Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock and Rassie van der Dussen both hit centuries for South Africa.
David Miller hit two back to back sixes off Glenn Phillips to cross 76 sixes - a record held by England in the 2019 edition of the tournament.
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: There are no post-match reflections mentioned in the article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's batting prowess has been led by Quinton de Kock, who on the day equalled the record of Rohit Sharma and Kumar Sangakkara for most hundreds in a single edition of the tournament - 4.
South Africa have also broken the record of most sixes hit in a single edition of the tournament.
Others: The match was played between South Africa and New Zealand on November 1, 2023, at the Maharashtra Cricket Association in Pune.
